newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-PBL continues to rise on casino deal.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-PBL continues to rise on casino deal.

text.p: Shares in Publishing and Broadcasting Ltd (PBL) continued to rise in early Tuesday trade following Monday's acquisition of management control at the Sydney casino.
At 11.30 a.m. (0030 GMT), PBL shares were 23 cents higher at at A$6.63 after earlier hitting a high of A$6.71, its highest level in just over eight years.

On Monday, PBL, which is 45 percent owned by media mogul Kerry Packer's family company Consolidated Press Holdings Ltd, said it would buy an 85 percent stake in the casino's management contract for A$240 million from Showboat Inc.

Also under the PBL-Showboat deal Packer's media group would buy a 10 percent stake in Sydney Harbour Casino Holdings Ltd (SHC) for A$1.85 per share. SHC shares hit a record high of A$2.27 after the deal announcement.
The remaining 15 percent stake in the casino management contract is owned by Leighton Holdings Ltd.
At 11.35 a.m. (0035 GMT), Sydney Harbour Casino shares were steady at A$2.22.
